conversation.content:
So Katie called me yesterday. [shocked] Out of nowhere, after three years of basically nothing. [confused] And she's getting married? [pause] I mean, I knew from Mom that she was dating someone but... [hesitantly] She wants me to be a bridesmaid. [long pause] 

[bitter] After everything that happened, she just calls and acts like— [sigh] I don't know. [very quietly] Part of me wanted to hang up immediately. [sad] All that stuff she said about me being selfish when Dad got sick, and now she needs matching dresses and, um, solidarity? 

[anxious] But then she started crying and saying how she's been in therapy and realizes she was projecting her grief onto me. [empathetically] And honestly, she sounded... different. [hopefully] Maybe she really has changed? [pause] God, I don't know if I can just stand there smiling in photos pretending we're, like, these close sisters when we haven't even— [frustrated] We haven't talked about any of it properly! 

[shaky voice] The thing is, I've missed her. [sniffle] I've really, really missed her. [warm] And maybe this is our chance to, um... to try again? [nervous] But what if it's just for show? [very quietly] What if after the wedding we go back to being strangers? [trailing off] I told her I'd think about it, but honestly I have no idea what to...

subject: Your previously estranged sibling asking you to be in their wedding party
